We're so lucky to have such a great public, local, shared resource as Conestoga and the whole THPRD system. The gym is clean and well maintained, and people come there for their health, not to show off. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Tigard Swim Center has friendly staff and an acceptable facility. However, there are some maintenance issues to address. Certain equipment, like the card printing machine and dryers, often don't work. The bathrooms, while still usable, could be cleaner. Overall, improvements in maintenance would enhance the experience for visitors.

This 25-yard pool is a bit older than the Tualatin pool. The pool temp is warmer, a little too warm for lap swimming, and the showers are rarely warm. I do wish they'd do a better job of coordinating the available lap swimming times when ‚Ä¶
Great place to take the family swimming during the week.  Only about 5 people in the pool during our visit on a Thursday evening.  Nice clean facility.  Will return again soon.

Doing the most good for the community. This building is being used to shelter some of Washington County's Houseless, until there's a more permanent place. They offer a place to sleep at night, three meals, a snack and case management.
Spacious, fairly clean, tables could use some tlc because of chipped paint but overall it's comfortable and nice.

Good morning. I went into this Pilot #390 assuming that I still have shower on my reward but it wasn‚Äôt . Miss Kathleen step in and help me out , she is a nice lady with an excellent customer service. Once again thank you so much in ‚Ä¶
Nice little truck stop. Fuel is always busy. I only come to shower and fuel. It's an older pilot so everything is old/used. But I'm thankful I even get to shower.

We run as a team and deliver to Hermiston monthly. Usually find a parking space to catch a couple of hours sleep,fuel, and a shower before delivery. Was disappointed to find no spots open, but got really angry when we found not one, but two ‚Ä¶
Nice, convenient spot. Michelle & Sharon took good care of us, quick and kind people here. Shower was clean & hot. They have hand dipped ice cream next to McDonald's ‚ò∫

Stopped in for a shower. The shower was spotless with plenty of hot water. However, the public men‚Äôs room was a mess. Broken stall, water soap and paper towels all over the sink and floor.

Only gets points for having a parking spot. $15 for a shower and no points for any purchases in the store. Only reward points for fuel purchases. You think you have a captive audience because of the Wal-Mart DC. Go the extra couple of miles ‚Ä¶
Loves is better they give points and free shower and free refills flying js do not.
Very friendly staff, clean shower rooms.  Restaurant was clean, great food, pleasant staff.

The first portion of the lot near the store is all reserved, the extended lot in the back doesn't get filled up. I see drop trailers in the back and the same bobtail drivers in front taking up dual spots. Selfish. Besides that, showers are ‚Ä¶

It ain't to bad here. It's quiet. Everyone is nice. I only give 3 stars because like most pilot flying j truck stops they haven't figured out how to build bigger bathrooms. I've been trying to get on the toilet for 2 days and there's always a line day and night.

We had stopped by purely due to the price of fuel in Washington. At the time of the visit, the price of fuel was $3.69/gal at the Pilot Truck Center. In the Tri-Cities, the price of fuel was $4.30/gal. Yes, it was definitely worth it. While ‚Ä¶

Very nice store, very clean, well stocked, good restaurants, good food. But manager Britney is the best part. So professional, kind, helpful. And her staff. Well done. Thank you. James  ps. And then general manager Becky in the morning. She ‚Ä¶
Plenty of free parking spaces in overflow lot. Was full around 5 pm.  Thank you for keeping the lot clean.  Friendly staff. Organized clean store. Restrooms are stocked and clean.

showerReviews.reviewText: This has stopped being a Truck Stop...it has become a local driver's drop yard.  Over the road drivers can't stop for a meal or a shower. Get your fuel and get out. Well, I didn't get a meal or my shower, but I decided to get my fuel ‚Ä¶
Not only is it cheapest fuel around... Commercial diesel. But if you get over 100 gallons you get half off in the diner and a shower!

Expect 2 hrs to get 50 gal fuel & 5 minute shower. You must literally hand them your permit to get fuel. No the 1 operable shower will not be clean even if you're the only truck there and employees standing around looking bord.
Don't shower at this location they don't clean and the towels are so thread bear they are see threw, the for issues you will have with your feet will take months to get rid of..

This place is super popular and is an ideal spot to stop and fuel up and get some snacks.  However, this place is super filthy. The bathroom door is falling off the hinge and the sinks are nasty. The outside of the building is also in ‚Ä¶

I haven't experienced a lot of what Crossroads has to offer, but it meets my needs well. For snacks, gas, or bathrooms late at night, I can't complain and have been to places that make Crossroads seem pretty wonderful. ‚Ä¶

The only hard thing about this truck stop is they don‚Äôt have showers/laundry facility. Otherwise, totally on point. The store is well stocked with a nice variety, the restaurant serves delicious food. Parking is somewhat limited (not a lot ‚Ä¶

Average truck stop, we stop here all the time. The bathrooms this time left a lot to be desired. They were out of paper towels and soap and looked like they needed a good cleaning. The whole place is just worn out lately. The cashier was ‚Ä¶
Got the job done. Parking and pumps are too close together. Vehicles competing for the same space. Restrooms are better than porta-potties. But I'm glad they were there when I needed a break.
